dsOverview.title: ETOPO1, Global 1 Arc-minute Ocean Depth and Land Elevation from the US National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC)

summary.p: ETOPO1 is a 1 arc-minute global relief model of Earth's surface that integrates land topography and ocean bathymetry. It was built from numerous global and regional data sets, and is available in "Ice Surface" (top of Antarctic and Greenland ice sheets) and "Bedrock" (base of the ice sheets) versions. Data are available in two grid registrations. For grid/node-registration, cells are centered on lines of latitude and longitude (21601 by 10801 cells), and for cell/pixel-registration, cell edges are along lines of latitude and longitude (21600 by 10800 cells). The grid-registered is the authoritative registration. The cell-registered is derived from the grid-registered, and the conversion produces slightly flattened relief.

creator.name: UCAR/NCAR/CISL/DSS > Data Support Section, Computational and Information Systems Laboratory, National Center for Atmospheric Research, University Corporation for Atmospheric Research

contributor.name: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NGDC > National Geophysical Data Center, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

reference.title: ETOPO1 1 Arc-Minute Global Relief Model: Procedures, Data Sources and Analysis
